answers.answer: Oh I'm so sorry you are feeling so sad.. i know it is sooo hard.. If you feel like crying.. just let it out. Spend the evening face down in the pillow, if that is what you need..That is the thing about ttc.. the MANY ups and downs... when you are feeling better, try to focus on opportunity ahead of you.. There is a baby out there waiting for you.. and it WILL happen.. keep believing that..  Not as fast as you would have liked and maybe not the way you had always planned it, but it WILLl happen.

Thanks for the advice - but still don't know why my emotions are running amuck!!  Would really like to put my head in a pillow and cry but will not get anywhere only a h/a and stuffy nose lol...  I am not going to even think for 1 second that I may be this month becuz of such a let down last month.  I did find out that my scan was paid by my insurance last month which is great to know .. But I guess this month we will be going with d/s.. Dh still upset when we talk about it but does understand and so do I that it is really hard to know it won't be his but I cannot think like that it will be ours.... and only ours...!!  He is just having a difficult time with just being diagnosed with diabetes and also the low sperm count he feels like he is not a "MAN".. but he more of a man than most men I know!!

I just want to give you a different perspective on the d/s.  I know it is not the dream you had to have a baby.  My aunt and uncle wanted a baby so badly that they were willing to try almost anything.  After a long time, they finally went for testing and found that my uncle was completely sterile.  They decided to try IUI with donor sperm.  It took them 10 months, but it finally worked.  They had a son.  He is now 31 years old.  No one in our family even knew that he was the result of donor sperm because they had picked such a good donor, that my cousin actually looks like my uncle.  My cousin knows the truth, and my aunt, uncle, and cousin all believe that it was a gift from God that the donor gave and my cousin is truly thankful to have been raised in such a loving home, always knowing that his dad is his real dad in every way but one, which is quite insignificant in the long run.  Good luck to you!

question: Well here we are 4 days post iui... I am totally a emotional mess.  I am starting to believe that all the things that our parents have done are coming back to haunt us by us not being able to conceive.  I asked my boss for next tuesday off and jokingly he goes take the whole f****** week off which I know he is only joking but of course my emotions today are not in the mood for such attitudes.  I totally haver terrible af cramps to beat the band and just want to sit and cry really for no reason at all - what is going on with me ???
title: Emotions running away
